website_summaries.verdict: If you are an advanced pogo stick user looking for major jumping ability, this is the one to get. Otherwise, it's likely to be too difficult to operate for the average user.
pros: Made for more than just fun
Tough metal build and springing action is ideal for experienced teens and adults
Good for performing stunts and tricks
cons: Not the best choice for kids or novices
Spring is stiff, requiring a break-in period for most

customer_reviews.title: Great Pogo Stick for Adults
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 59 year old hubby for his birthday. I purchased a Flybar pogo stick for our 6 year old granddaughter and Grandpa was jealous. He'd had a pogo stick when he was young and loved it. Well, he's in love again! He's mastered the pogo stick in a very short period of time. For the record, he's just under 6 feet tall and weighs 200 lbs. This pogo stick has a very stiff spring. My hubby doesn't bottom out this pogo stick - even jumping hard. Our son is 6 feet 2 inches and 220 lbs. and he has to try very hard to bottom out the pogo stick. This is definitely appropriate for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for up to a 1,022 jumps
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the regular versions of this pogo stick for the kids and this one for my husband for Christmas. Of course, we all had to go out there and see who can jump the longest. I can vouch for this stick up to one thousand twenty two jumps. Husband beat my record by ten jumps the next day and I have zero interest in jumping for 20 minutes straight again for another record....but the pogo stick is great. The spring hasn't buckled under the weight and the pad on the bottom is still intact after 7 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: AlyciainTX

customer_reviews.title: Addictive!
customer_reviews.text: My 6-1/2 year old grandson got this as a gift, and spent most of his winter break from school outside, bouncing on it, on our driveway. He graduated from doing two bounces with support, to doing over 200 consecutive bounces without falling, and making deliberate designs by jumping in specific directions, all within a week. He absolutely loves it!! (I would not get this model for a much older child, though, because even at about 50 lbs., he is occasionally "bottoming out" the spring when he jumps and says that is uncomfortable). He'll need one with a stronger spring, soon.
customer_reviews.author: SetterRescueMom

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I am in my 60s and this is an awesome exercise machine.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie E Walker Jr

customer_reviews.title: It easily supports my 200 lbs
customer_reviews.text: This pogo stick is very high quality, and it is basically the same as the one I had as a kid built for an adult. It easily supports my 200 lbs, and at 5'11", the height is perfect. I would advise parents looking to purchase this for a child to look elsewhere- the minimum weight is 120 lbs to even engage the spring, and it is probably about 4 1/2 high or more. The rubber nub did fall out once, but J.B. Weld secured it in place quite nicely and it hasn't fallen out again since. For the price, this is a great entry level pogo sticks for adults looking for a jumping type workout or fun with simple tricks.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This pogo stick fits me perfectly. The handles are at the right height, hip level. I'm pretty tall (5' 9") and I weight 155. Since I used to bounce a lot as a kid, it was like riding a bike. I got right on and did 24 in a row, first time in 4 decades. Pogo is a great workout! I'm now bouncing in the 100s. Nice sturdy pogo with heavy duty spring. Didn't take long to break it in. I can bounce high or low, it's easy to control. If you are on the tall side, get this one instead of one of the shorter ones, the higher handles make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Kreativart

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: We originally got a $50ish pogo for our 12yr old son for Christmas. The foam on the handle immediately started failing. We saw this one and decided to upgrade. We weren’t totally sure if it would be too much to handle for our son but decided that the heftier construction and great reviews made it worth giving it a shot. It was a big difference right away. It is definitely heavy. But for our son, it was a better fit. Initially he got bruising on his knees pretty badly, but he persevered and that seems to have diminished in a matter of weeks. The handles are very sturdy and have a bike-like grip. Super glad we went this route.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: For once, I don't weigh enough
customer_reviews.text: I think this could be a really fun thing for adults. However, the weight range does not seem accurate. The spring is very, very tight. Although I weigh comfortably between the 120-210 pound range, there is no bounce in the pogo stick. I really think the spring is better geared for the higher end of the product's design weight.
customer_reviews.author: Book infatuation

customer_reviews.title: Great for big boys 170-220 lbs that want to mess around with a pogo stick
customer_reviews.text: Me and my 50+ yr old 190-210 lb brothers wanted to pogo like our kids. This thing is built TOUGH, 210 lbs and it does not bottom out. Built like a tank, it’s heavy and tough, about a month and it’s holding out great. I would definitely recommend for any adult 170-220 lbs, that wants to mess around with a pogo stick. If you want to do some crazy competition stuff you probably want to look for something more sofisticated.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuru101

customer_reviews.title: 220 lb kid, maybe a little too big.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Pogo stick because I loved pogoing when I was growing up. I'm now 6'3 220lbs. The Pogo is rate up to 220lbs, and that seems to be pretty accurate. I can jump on this thing without bottoming out, but not very high (~10-12"). If I jump any higher it bottoms out pretty easily. On the other hand, it does serve it's purpose and seems to be well built. I don't think I'll break it and it's a fun toy to bounce around on. The knee problem is there, but it's pretty minor. I didn't have bruised knees, but you can feel the pogo rubbing up against your knees as you jump. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky but solidly manufactured
customer_reviews.text: Squeaky when bouncing but even at 205 lbs it still works for me, great exercise. I'm going to try WD40 and see if it helps with the squeaking. Next one up for me is the one for 200-300 lb adults, I think they're pneumatic.
customer_reviews.author: L.D.

customer_reviews.title: Advertised Weight Capacity Is Wrong and Causes Brusing - Bad Logo Placement
customer_reviews.text: my son is 130 lbs...well under 200. He bottomed out immediately. Also the logo hurts his knees. FLybar duped me and won't let me return it. Not a good company to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: BassRacer

customer_reviews.title: No problems so far
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely for big kids and adults. My son is over 6 ft and he can launch himself frankly too high. This is one of the toys his friends want to play with when they come over.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Maybe you will have better luck than we did...
customer_reviews.text: We had to return ours for a refund, fulfilled by Amazon quickly and without problems. The pogo stick wasn't structurally true, as the handles weren't parallel to the foot pegs! Additionally, one of the handles was shaped lower than the other and where the metal was curved/bent (handles and the body) it had small stress fractures. Beyond that, it seemed decent quality materials for the price. Did not contact the company for resolution/replacement, so uncertain if this is an exception for their product. Hopefully this won't be your experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mary in KC

customer_reviews.title: This was an awesome gift for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome gift for my daughter. She loves it, very well made, sturdy. Her children love to watch her jump. Flybar very good brand. This pogo was for fun not professional.
customer_reviews.author: P. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Painful pogo
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this pogo stick gave my grand daughter very bruised and battered knees... bad placement of the center logo it's too wide.... But is sure is heavy and durable...
customer_reviews.author: greenie

customer_reviews.title: A pogo stick that is well made and lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy pogo stick!! Meant for adult or larger child/teenager. It delivers. Pogo stick seems well made and can handle all the jumping that a person can give it!
customer_reviews.author: DSR

customer_reviews.title: 10 year old loves this but beware - it goes ...
customer_reviews.text: 10 year old loves this but beware - it goes really high so I made him wear a helmet. I also noticed that his thighs were completely bruised from hitting the metal bar so I I got him some adult knee pads and that has protected them from bruising. This is a serious pogo stick.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: My older teenage children love this. I chose this model because they are ...
customer_reviews.text: My older teenage children love this. I chose this model because they are not small children anymore. I have one child who is 140 pounds and it's a little harder for them to jump as high on it, but it's a really cool pogo stick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and fun!
customer_reviews.text: This pogo stick is very durable.I had one when I was young.I am now 58 and can still jump up and down.I never lost that touch.I can't jump as long but if your looking for a good exercise,balance and a whole lot of fun this is it.I weigh 210 and feel very safe on it.ps my girlfriend owes me dinner as she bet I couldn't jump up and down 25 times without stopping.The very first time I got on.ENJOY UPDATE: Had now 6 yrs. broke foot rest but my fault as I weigh 235 now. So 😥!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel James

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty is a bold claim
customer_reviews.text: Pros: good spring You can jump high Reasonable weight limit Cons: makes some noise Parts at the bottom of pogo stick wear out easily (but can be easily repaired) Rubber at the bottom wears out too fast Spinning while bouncing Can give you bruises when bouncing I give it 3.8/5
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Too much tension!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for me and my husband to get some fun exercise in our garage and basement when it is cold outside. The product description says it's for weights 120 -210 lbs. I'm on the low end and he is on the higher end, yet both of us agree that the tension is too tight. Will be returning for another model.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: My son loves the stick, but despite the reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the stick, but despite the reviews which stated the side pieces were fixed so it does not rub and bruise your legs, we found that was not the case. However, he is overlooking that because he loves to jump on a pogo stick so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: I'm about 195lbs and have a blast on this with my daughters who have the smaller kids version. I'd love more lift, but it does exactly what the spec's say, and has taken a beating. If you don't weigh enough, you can't use this, but that's just a nature of the spring and not a complaint. I see many more years of use out of this. If you're the type that likes to play with the kids doing what they are doing, or just getting some jumping exercise this is a great pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Super Pogo 1505 Pogo stick
customer_reviews.text: The product description was not thorough enough. It stated that the user should be within a specific weight range, but it gave no height or age range. When the product arrived, the outside of the box had a label that said, must be at least age 14. Our child could not use it very easily and we ended up buying another pogo stick more suited to the child's height and age. Also, the box was damaged upon arrival, though the product was intact. We will set it aside until the child is older and taller.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It's an awesome toy for an adult who doesn't want to give ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an awesome toy for an adult who doesn't want to give up hanging with their kids and jumping around . Alot if fun and definitely fits weight range , I'm 205 lbs and have no issues with it bottoming out .I actually have neighbors who r coming out of their shell and having fun again. I would suggest it to all who r interested
customer_reviews.author: jeff butler

customer_reviews.title: Takes 160 lbs easily
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little effort to get it going but takes 160 lbs easily. Good bounce and I think once you practice a little you may be able to do some tricks with it. You do have to adjust your stance a little so you don't hit your knees in the center. Our son loves it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Shay Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and well built.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. It is very heavy duty. It looks like it will last for many years. This item is very well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: NC consumer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pogo stick
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pogo stick. Bought for my 12 year old son, pay attention to the weight range as my son is a little light at 110 lbs . With a 185 lbs adult it works as advertised, and the boy will get bigger.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: ok but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Item is extremely heavy so heavy kids cannot use it
customer_reviews.author: E. Montague

customer_reviews.title: It is a good exercise for the core muscles and he has fun ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the strongest Pogo stick ever. Bought it for our 11 year old 5'8" 175 pound son to train on and he loves it!! It is a good exercise for the core muscles and he has fun doing it too! It is very solid, heavy and the bounce is amazing from it!!
customer_reviews.author: maggiemom

customer_reviews.title: Good pogo stick for adults!
customer_reviews.text: I am 50 years old and never had a pogo stick as a kid. But watching some people pogo on TV one night I said I'm going to get one! I'm getting better and having fun with this stick. It is surprising how good of a workout you can get. I think the SP 1505 is well built, sturdy, and reasonably priced. Like the other reviewer said, if you're near the lower end of the weight range, the spring *may* be too stiff. I'm 165 lbs and it works great for me. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Messerschmitt

customer_reviews.title: It is good
customer_reviews.text: Do not get for a kid under the weight limit it is so hard for them but the best pogo I have ever had i have had like 999,999,999,999,999,999 not really I had like 12 but still allot
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: great customer service
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yo daughter absolutely LOVES her pogo stick (bought in April 2010 from Amazon) and was devastated when it bent. Didn't seem possible to bend it but it did nevertheless. I contacted flybar customer service and within an hour they had a replacement in the mail. They said there was a "bad batch" and were happy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this pogo stick, and it is amazing! I weigh 140 lbs, and im 16 years old. The first time I tried it, I hit my knee on the body, and that hurt, but if you wrap your legs around it, it is perfect! The spring is strong, and I can barely get it to bottom out, which is great! I highly recommend it if you are within the weight guidelines because the spring is so strong. My only criticism is that on hot summer days like today, sweaty hands lose some grip on the handlebars. To get around this, I wear gloves. TL;DR, its an amazing pogo stick
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Once again, my husband and I received rave reviews for our selection of the Super Pogo 1505 for our grandson's birthday present! I was not there to see it, but by all accounts, this pogo stick far exceeded all expectations. One word of caution....Make SURE the recipient not only HAS a helmet...but also USES it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Eardley

customer_reviews.title: painful fun
customer_reviews.text: This pogo stick is durable and has good bounce. I have fun using it however I can't go for very long because it is painful. I get huge bruises on the insides of my knees every time I use it. The design needs work because I know I'm not the only one who has this problem. I have started wearing heavy duty knee pads to protect me from bruising.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Pogo for Life
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old son has been wanting a pogo stick for a long time. We purchased this one at christmas. He enjoys jumping on it and trying to beat his jumping record each time. It also provides good exercise. It is strong enough for an adult to jump around on, but it is a lot harder than it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Brandie

customer_reviews.title: No bounce
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one with less resistance. They can't get any bounce out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Hart

customer_reviews.title: It works great, but is stiff at first and you definitely ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great, but is stiff at first and you definitely need to weigh enough to use it! My 12yr (80lbs) has to work at it, but can do it, and hopefully won't wear it out in 3 months like the smaller on we got him!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel SankoKirchen

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what fun!
customer_reviews.text: Very well built! Works great! Lots of fun! I hadn't been on a pogo stick since I was about 12. I weigh 220# which is a little more than the rating of this pogo stick (210#). I can bottom it out after three or four hard jumps. But otherwise I can bounce smoothly as long as I want. It's very well balanced and has lots of smooth spring action and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Bensch

customer_reviews.title: brings back memories
customer_reviews.text: I used to pogo back in the day, I got my girlfriend and kids a 160 pound pogo, I can do it but I bottom out. at 230 pounds I need something bigger. This is perfect, its taller and great exercise too.
customer_reviews.author: yo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gift
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty pogo stick. I am 41 years old and I can even use this thing! I bought it for my daughter and I think I am the one that feels like a kid again. Her step-Dad used it as well. Great quality for the older kid 100+ lbs.
customer_reviews.author: debbie lemenager

customer_reviews.title: and the Flybar Super Pogo bounces me around like a toy
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 190 lbs. and the Flybar Super Pogo bounces me around like a toy. This thing is well made and durable, 1,000 pogos and counting.
customer_reviews.author: GaryWaddell

customer_reviews.title: So Happy together.
customer_reviews.text: This was a good buy. I was trying to find a pogo stick that was long enough for my 6'4" son and that would hold his 6'4" weight. This is industrial strength and my son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Rocio

customer_reviews.title: It is probably great for a larger person than he is
customer_reviews.text: Returned this pogo stock. My son complained that his knees hurt when he tried to use it. It is probably great for a larger person than he is.
customer_reviews.author: L.  Miller

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for my teenager - gets much more air now than on his smaller pogo stick.
customer_reviews.author: EV

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Having lots of fun and laughs using this SP!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Shera

customer_reviews.title: The pogo is awesome
customer_reviews.text: The Super Pogo 1505 Stick is such a great device. I am 45 yrs. old and grew up on the pogo stick. This particular product is awesome and I can do jumps I thought never was possible, it has been a great form of exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Pernell R. Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to exercise!!!
customer_reviews.text: It works really good my kids and husband enjoyed it a lot!!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Super Pogo 1505 Pogo Stick
customer_reviews.text: Fun for the more "mature" big kids in the family! This is for the dad's and uncles who want to show the kids they still got it!
customer_reviews.author: Shelba Kelly

customer_reviews.title: ... the kids on the street are jealous of my sweet pogo stick
customer_reviews.text: All the kids on the street are jealous of my sweet pogo stick.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L.

customer_reviews.title: and works perfect for his weight range
customer_reviews.text: my son is 165 lbs. and works perfect for his weight range.
customer_reviews.author: KEG

customer_reviews.title: Looked more fun than it really is
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Pogo Stick as birthday gift for my 9 year old son. He loved it when he opened it up, but, soon became bored. It is quite sturdy. I imagine he can give it to his son when he has one. My 200lb, 6'3",41 year old husband loves it, however
customer_reviews.author: LDB

customer_reviews.title: POGO
customer_reviews.text: The was a very sturdy piece of equipment. The spring was larg4e and the young man in addition to his parents van used it without breaking
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann McGraw

customer_reviews.title: Big Bounce
customer_reviews.text: I haven't pogoed for 35 years. This thing is amazing and when I was jumping in the rain and fell on my ass, it was still fun. Embarrassing, but fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jungle Boy

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pogo stick. It is very durable, has a good action, and is a lot of fun to bounce on. My son loves it. I do too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this pogo stick and hasn't stopped bouncing since Christmas. He wanted an upgrade from his old one and couldn't be happier. It is rated for over 120 lbs. and my son is only 90, but since he already was good at it, it works fine. I wouldn't recommend it for a beginner under 100 lbs, though.
customer_reviews.author: B. McClane

customer_reviews.title: Best pogo ever
customer_reviews.text: Wow is it bouncy. Not for kids under 75 pounds as the spring is too stiff. Above that and you're golden
customer_reviews.author: cg

customer_reviews.title: Great pogo stick!
customer_reviews.text: This pogo stick is amazing! It's durable enough that my 230lb husband can use it with ease, yet sensitive enough that my 120lb sister can use it and it goes down smoothly on each bounce without sticking or resistance. Best pogo stick I've ever used!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: PoGo rific
customer_reviews.text: I choose this because I wanted one that was heavy duty,lightweight, recommended and of a specific design.140 lb teenager was going to abuse this and I didn't want it to tear up and perform. This thing has delivered all that and more.Recommend for anyone 100lb to 200lb. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: capt4377

customer_reviews.title: It was great to find one that was for her weight
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is enjoying her pogo stick. It was great to find one that was for her weight, she enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great pogo stick for 200 lb dude
customer_reviews.text: Pogo stick came ready-to-go right out of the box. The stick is of high quality materials, and has handled significant abuse thus far. I would order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Griffith, Live for a Living

customer_reviews.title: Lost weight but at a cost
customer_reviews.text: My 14 yr-old son LOVED this pogo stick....until it started bruisihng his inner thighs. He insulated the metal bars with foam and duct tape so it was more comfortable to use. He lost weight and tightened his abs--a great by product of simply wanting to do something fun. We were all thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Jo

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a gift and it went over great and works great. Very satisfied. Came in the mail fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Foot platform broke less than an hour after I got it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a 14 yr old boy and he and his friends are having a great time in mastering tricks and seeing whom can beat the other in staying on. Great durable, sturdy pogo stick that is well worth the money for it gives a great workout for the kids and they spend hours trying to outdo each other.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Dont overuse!
customer_reviews.text: When i first got this pogo stick, it worked fantastically, but i was constantly using it, and after about two months, the whole thing suddenly fell apart while i was jumping. So if you are going to be using this product a lot, invest in a better pogo stick! although if you are just occasionally going to be using it, its pretty good. NOTE: DO NOT POGO INTO THE MUD WITH THIS EITHER! I DID A FEW TIME AND THE BOTTOM STOPPER FELL OFF AND I HAD TO REPLACE IT MULTIPLE TIMES WITH DUCT TAPE BALLS. DO NOT POGO INTO THE MUD!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Paulet

customer_reviews.title: works great for our older kids
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, works great for our older kids. More sturdy than anything else wE had.
customer_reviews.author: Robert and Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Like being a kid again
customer_reviews.text: So much fun without a high price tag. Very solid construction. After significant use, tip is showing no wear. Let your inner kid come out and get one...highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mosgr8tful

customer_reviews.title: Dad loves his pogo!
customer_reviews.text: We got it for him for his birthday. He is 53. He said the spring was stiff and he had a hard time, but then it eventually was easier and he jumps around all day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to check the weight limits. This is ...
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to check the weight limits. This is definitely more for an adult than my 12 year old grandson for whom I purchased. He can bounce to the moon and back on it.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Brewer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and lots of "bounce". Fun for adults - might be heavy for kids. Handle bars are not straight across if you are accustom to a pogo stick with straight handles it may take awhile to get used to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Hudson

customer_reviews.title: SUPER POGO
customer_reviews.text: GRANDSON LOVED HIS NEW POGO STICK, HE HAS MOVED UP EVERY COUPLE OF YEARS AND AT 13 LOVED THIS STICK, IT ARRIVED ON HIS BIRTHDAY WHICH WAS A GREAT THING. SEEMS STURDY AND HE DOESN'T BOTTOM IT OUT. HE IS NOT A VERY HEAVY KID AND I WASN'T SURE HE WOULD BE ABLE TO GET THE HEIGHT THAT HE DOES GET. VERY HAPPY WITH IT AND THE COMPANY THAT MADE IT. THANKS
customer_reviews.author: DEENYAS

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT HOLD MY GRANDSONS WEIGHT
customer_reviews.text: Pogo Stick was ok but it did not hold the weight it specified ON THE DOWN PLUNGE THANK YOU VERY MUCH
customer_reviews.author: George S. Dimirack Sr.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for 2 months and the foot peg broke off with someone that was only 195 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Black

customer_reviews.title: Great pogo stick
customer_reviews.text: Great pogo stick! I weigh 165 and it is perfect with no sign of bottoming out. Takes me back to when I was 10 again! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: Kids love this
customer_reviews.text: My kids will actually spend quite a bit of time on a pogo stick when they get going. The last one we had couldn't hold the weight of teenagers and would bottom out. Our sons and their friends can really bounce on is thing.
customer_reviews.author: TRACEY MCCLAIN

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This was the third summer with this pogo stick. My son who has autism enjoys going on it. That is until one of the pedals snapped off and he became very upset. The description claims it withstands weight up to 210 lbs. My son is 185 lbs. Paying 103.00 for this it should've lasted a lot longer than just 3 summers 1 of which we were away for so actually it was 2 summers of use. I've been looking to possibly replace the pedals but no luck. I would have to buy another one which I can't afford right now. May as well buy a cheaper one that would probably last just as short.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Fun, rugged
customer_reviews.text: revert back to your inner child!! takes a little practice but easy to master and a lot of fun, well made
customer_reviews.author: Penna

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Having a great time learning tricks on my new pogo stick but I have bruises on the inside of my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Remi Dube

customer_reviews.title: One had bruises
customer_reviews.text: One of our group had bruises on the inside of the knee after using this. Overall, I think it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: digger

customer_reviews.title: my review on super pogo1505
customer_reviews.text: I received mine few days ago and my first impression --> very very heavy and too long (won't fit the back of mini cooper) but it seems very very very durable :) I'm 177 pounds and I feel that the spring are way too hard that it might be more suitable for 190 pounds and above. I wish theres a way to adjust the spring. My other complain is... it makes too much noise !! any suggestion on kind of oil or spray to use ? Thanks :) I really wish I got the kiddie version ones so I can also use it in my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ang

customer_reviews.title: A good hop.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this item for more than a month now - use it 2-3 times a week for exercise only (I'm 45 years old), not extreme tricks or jumping through flaming hoops. Had a pogo stick as a kid but not since. Unit is solid-feeling and springs are correct for my weight of 190 lbs. Unit works well and is fun exercise for me (it'll get me huffing and puffing quickly) - I'm sure to wear a helmet and pads just in case. So far this pogo stick is as advertised and has been a worthwhile purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: My older teenage son wanted a pogo stick for Christmas. Most of the pogo sticks on the market are made for younger, lighter kids, but not this one. I was very impressed with the durability. This is a pogo stick that an adult can use. In fact, if you are not very heavy, you will not even be able to make the pogo stick move.
customer_reviews.author: jesusfreak

customer_reviews.title: Fun & tough.  A little wide in the middle.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 years and it's worked well for me. Pros: Fun to have an adult-sized pogo stick. I'm 6'2" ~190lbs and it works great for me. Cons: The middle part is large and has surfaces that you can scrape or bang your legs against.
customer_reviews.author: jeb

customer_reviews.title: Not a great idea at all!
customer_reviews.text: I really take time to read reviews before making any purchases on Amazon. This is not safe for teenagers, even experienced ones. This model is way too hard to jump on and way too easy to fall off of. The springs are too tight and even the hardest jumps don't make the unit move with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lover

customer_reviews.title: The Pole is too wide, hurt son
customer_reviews.text: The width of the pogo stick bruised my son's legs, and he ended up duct-taping it and trying to make it work anyway so then it was too late for me to try to exchange or return it. He was really bummed, and tried to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Vanderwoude

product_meta.title: Flybar Super Pogo Pogo Stick for Kids and Adults 14 & Up Heavy Duty for Weights 120-210 Lbs
product_meta.description:
The Gravity Games super pogo stick is the only pogo stick available to accommodate extreme jumping. Made with heavy-duty metal construction and a virtually indestructible Nitrile rubber tip, this stick is made to last. It's made by the same company that originated the pogo stick in 1918, but this isn't your grandfather's pogo. This performance pogo stick has reinforced injection-molded clamps and steps, and has a manufacturer suggested weight range of 120-220 pounds. The super pogo complies with all federal safety standards, but protective gear should always be worn while jumping.

AMAZON.COM
Bounce your way to fun and excitement with this spring-powered pogo stick for the 21st century. The Super Pogo 1505 accommodates extreme jumping for riders weighing from 120 to 210 pounds. It features a durable steel construction and stiff piston built for high jumps, wild tricks, and high performance pogo fun. Every design element--from the rugged steel construction (with a foam outer covering) to the injection molded steps and Nitrile rubber tip--make this stick ideal for fast and high bouncing. It's recommended for ages 14 and older. As a safety precaution, it is recommended to always use a helmet. This pogo stick weighs 10.4 pounds. Minimal assembly required. It's backed by a 1-year warranty.
feature_bullets: Meant for ages as low as 14 & Up to adults weighing from 120 to 210 pounds

CLASSIC TRICK POGO STICK: The Super Pogo is a classic pogo stick from Flybar meant for extreme jumping and technical pogo tricks but is always great for beginners who want to learn to pogo. Nothing beats a classic.

HEAVY DUTY METAL CONSTRUCTION: Strong spring powered pogo stick made of a heavy metal construction with reinforced injected-molded clamps and steps that will hold up for the most technical pogo tricks.

WIDE STANCE FOOT PEGS: The Super Pogo by Flybar features large wide stance foot pegs with grip tape so you have the ultimate control whether you are just casual jumping or doing extreme tricks. Strong and reinforced to handle peg stalls on curbs or rail

LEARN BALANCE & COORDINATION SKILLS: In a fun and exciting way. So much fun that won’t even realize that you are exercising. The Flybar Super Pogo is meant for beginners all the way up to experts. Perfect if you want to just jump around or if you are pr

specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
